attributes.action: UK must ratify the optional protocol to the UN Rights of the Child Convention.
attributes.background: This important addition to the Convention gives members of the public and child sexual abuse victims the right to directly raise issues & complaints with the UN Committe on the Rights of the Child and its members. The majority of EU countries have ratified but the UK is conspicuous by its absence.
attributes.additional_details: The unratifed "communication" protocol  allows child sex abuse victims to raise complaints directly with the UN Committee in relation to public authorities failing to safeguard and protect children in relation to child sexual abuse after exhausting all internal remedies. That this protocol has not been ratified is bizarre given the UK's failings in this area.  Failings which have become somewhat of a daily news occurrence in recent years.  It would give individual abuse victims a voice at the UN.

attributes.action: Devolve Corporation Tax to the Scottish Parliament
attributes.background: We want lower taxes for businesses in Scotland, which probably means lower corporation tax rather than lower income tax. So now, I call on the UK government to devolve corporation tax.
attributes.additional_details: If the Scottish Parliament had the power to set corporation tax at a lower rate, then it would encourage more businesses to move up to Scotland. In my opinion, this would probably suit a lot of businesses. And I would also call on all parties at Westminster to work together to achieve this.

attributes.action: Make it law for all age restricted products to require approved photo ID.
attributes.background: Across the country retail workers face verbal and physical abuse because of asking to see ID. The guessing of a customers age is what causes these cases of abuse with customers trying to intimidate the member of staff into selling the product. A no ID no sale law would put an end to the daily abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence shows that there are more than 6000 incidents a day of verbal or physical abuse of retail workers because they requested to see ID for an age restricted product. A simple law that states no ID no sale on all age restricted products would remove the possibility of human error in having to guess people's ages and would help to stop the verbal and physical abuse that occurs because of this.

attributes.action: Exempt Charities from paying Insurance Premium Tax (IPT)
attributes.background: We believe the Government should be doing everything it can to support the vital work charities are doing, not imposing unnecessary costs on them. We call for charities to be exempted from Insurance Premium Tax (IPT).
attributes.additional_details: The Government could introduce an exemption from, or reduction in, IPT for all UK Charities. A further rise in the rate of standard UK IPT was announced recently. From 1st June 2017 IPT charged on charities' insurance premiums increased to 12%. This represents a 100% increase in an 18 month period. These increases have and will continue to negatively affect charities who have already suffered in the last few years from reduced income while seeing an increase in the demand for their services.

attributes.action: Make schools and colleges have longer or more breaks between working times.
attributes.background: Many schools do not have long enough breaks between work periods, I suggest the solution that schools and colleges get more time at breaks or have breaks at regular intervals. Such as expanding a 15 minute break to being 25 minutes to encourage socialising to make school an enjoyable environment.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of over the counter codeine based pain killers
attributes.background: Codeine is a drug that is sold without prescription in the UK. It is used by drug addicted in order to “get high” in big dosage, which is equal to what’s contained in one pack (30 tablets). It is banned for opened sale in US, Germany, Japan and Australia.

attributes.action: Make sure we get a Brexit Deal.
attributes.background: If Brexit didn't have a deal, it would be chaos for us. If we can't get a  deal, we're on our own, and we'll have to rely on other countries to give us power and maybe being the end of the UK altogether. So there must be a Brexit deal, or we're in anarchy.

attributes.action: I want to start a petition to ban fixed odds betting machines in all book makers
attributes.background: I want to ban all fixed odd gaming machine in all bookmakers. I think these machines exploit people and the human brain, these bookmakers spend thousands of pounds in doing this. People have ruined thier own lives and people around them lives by playing these highly addictive machines.

attributes.action: Increase the capacity of prisons by building 5 new prisons by 2022.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK over the last few years the increase of crime has put pressure onto prisons and the justice system. Therefore because there aren't enough spaces in prisons, criminals may get away with crimes they have committed. If more prisons are built, it will create more space for criminals.

attributes.action: Introduce a separate, higher minimum wage for temporary workers and agency staff
attributes.background:
This petition is to help address the issue of unstable employment in our economy and to help promote the concerns about zero hour and temporary contracts. 
If temporary workers were given a higher minimum wage then this could encourage employers to offer permanent contracts and reduce exploitation.

attributes.action: Make rehabilitation the main aim of a Judge when sentencing criminals.
attributes.background: In the UK, the main aim of Judges while sentencing is a mix of rehabilitation and deterrence, however, I believe that by deciding on one main aim, we could reduce reoffending rates.
attributes.additional_details:

The link above will take you to a trusted news website. The selected page is all about how the rehabilitation rates in Switzerland are lower than in America, Therefore, proving our point.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on whether or not we have a transitional deal from March 2019.
attributes.background: Ask that the Government now give the British people a referendum on whether or not we have a transitional deal from March 2019. If the vote is no, then there must be no transitional deal, and we must be out of the single market, the customs union and the rulings of EU courts from March 2019.
attributes.additional_details: There are more Remain supporting MPs than Leave supporting MPs. Parliament cannot be trusted. The Government now seems intent on making a transitional deal from March 2019 and giving the EU large sums of UK taxpayers` money from that date. The period from June 2016 to March 2019 should be considered sufficient for everyone to adapt to a full break from the EU in March 2019.

attributes.action: Ban robotic trading of stocks, shares or financial derivatives
attributes.background: Robotic/algorithmic trading  of stocks, shares and financial derivatives are used by big corporates to steal money from retail investors.
attributes.additional_details: Big banks and institutions should not be allowed do use automatic trading which could cause flash crash in the markets eventually stealing money from weak hands of retail investors. Such trading should be banned. Markets would be less volatile and retail investors feel more secured to invest in such a situation.

attributes.action: Ban the use of video interviews using computer analysis to select candidates
attributes.background: Many companies have began using video interviews in their application process. These interviews are reviewed by a computer and never seen by a person. The algorithms used cannot account for behavioural differences exhibited by people with disabilities and so, it removes them as viable candidates.
attributes.additional_details: Video interview algorithms are set up to analyses both verbal and non-verbal communication. The main problem with this system is that the characteristics which are deemed to be ‘good’ are generally characteristics which people with learning difficulties, such as ADHD or Aspergers will never display under the circumstances of a video interview. In an actual face to face interview, the interviewer can understand and account for the difference in communication while an algorithm cannot.

attributes.action: Set minimum prices for milk and other dairy products
attributes.background: Supermarkets force dairy farms to sell milk at below production costs or lose contracts. So dairy farms prioritise milk yield of cattle over animal welfare leading to cruelty(e.g zero grazing, unhealthy cattle selectively bred for milk yield only). Huge amounts of unsold milk is poured down drains.
attributes.additional_details:
Milk is still cheaper than bottled water, even after recent price rises due to some dairies being driven out of business by having to sell to supermarkets at a loss, reducing supply. That's crazy.

attributes.action: I believe that every adult in the UK should pay £10 a month to the NHS.
attributes.background: I have been admitted into hospital twice in 5 years for 2 major life changing operations. I noticed how loving and caring the porters, nurses, doctors and surgeons all were. I was very shocked to see that they work 12+ hours a day, clean, cook, pay for parking and bring their own food.
attributes.additional_details: I would rather spend my £13.12 (which I have to pay every month for my BBC TV LICENCE) on the NHS. It should be compulsory!

attributes.action: Stop Dartford toll fees.
attributes.background: The authorities said that as soon as the bridge was paid for the fees would stop.

attributes.action: Standardise the tax rates for employment income with all other income sources
attributes.background:
If you receive most income from your employment, there is a 99% chance that you are probably ‘poor’ or, at least, not part of the 1% high wealth individuals.
The wealthy avoid high employment income tax rates and instead exploit generous allowances and lower tax rates on all other forms of income.
attributes.additional_details:
By standardising the tax rates on all forms of income, employment tax rates will fall since the disproportionate tax benefits available to the super-rich only will be reduced to create a fair tax system.

All income say, under £1m, including receipts from loans from non-UK sources and gains from share schemes, should be treated equally for tax purposes and thereafter a minimum tax rate of 10% should cap any excessive tax breaks. 
Personal allowance and capital gain exemption could also be combined.

attributes.action: Put a tax on fish so fish can flourish more in the ocean.
attributes.background: Over fishing is declining fishes numbers so if there were a tax on buying them fishing would decline and the government would get more money.

attributes.action: Educate people on buying bikes, bike safety and bike security.
attributes.background: So many people go off to buy cheap bikes and they have faults very quickly.So they throw it away or repair and replace parts often, this can a have a negative impact on the environment and people will ride bikes less, increasing the negative impact on the environment.We should ride bikes a lot more.
